demos.question: That Darn Cat! and Never a Dull Moment were both produced by what studio?
demos.trajectory:
[[ ## tool_name_init ## ]]
AdvancedSearch

[[ ## tool_args_init ## ]]
{"search_query": "That Darn Cat! and Never a Dull Moment were both produced by what studio?"}

[[ ## thought_init ## ]]
I will start by searching for relevant documents with the original question as the search query.

[[ ## observation_init ## ]]
{"search_query": "That Darn Cat! and Never a Dull Moment were both produced by what studio?", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "Never a Dull Moment (1968 film) | Never a Dull Moment is a 1968 American comedy crime film from Walt Disney Productions starring Dick Van Dyke and Edward G. Robinson and directed by Jerry Paris. The script by AJ Carothers was based on a novel by John Godey. The supporting cast features Dorothy Provine, Henry Silva, Slim Pickens and Jack Elam.", "score": 18.828125}, {"long_text": "Never a Dull Moment (1950 film) | Never a Dull Moment is a 1950 American comedy film from RKO, starring Irene Dunne and Fred MacMurray. The film is based on the 1943 book \"Who Could Ask For Anything More?\" by Kay Swift. The filming took place between December 5, 1949, and February 1, 1950.", "score": 18.484375}, {"long_text": "Never a Dull Moment (EP) | Never a Dull Moment is the collaborative EP by rapper Willie the Kid and producer Lee Bannon. It was released on July 27, 2010 through Apphiliates Music Group and Embassy Entertainment.", "score": 17.65625}]}

[[ ## thought_0 ## ]]
Now that I have identified the studio for "Never a Dull Moment (1968 film)", I should check if the same studio produced "That Darn Cat!".

[[ ## tool_name_0 ## ]]
AdvancedSearch

[[ ## tool_args_0 ## ]]
{"search_query": "That Darn Cat! was produced by what studio?", "trajectory_id": "advance_search_result_1"}

[[ ## observation_0 ## ]]
{"search_query": "That Darn Cat! was produced by what studio?", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "That Darn Cat! | That Darn Cat! is a 1965 American Walt Disney Productions thriller comedy film starring Hayley Mills (in her last of the six films she made for the Walt Disney Studios) and Dean Jones (starring in his first film for Disney) in a story about bank robbers, a kidnapping and a mischievous cat. The film was based on the 1963 novel \"Undercover Cat\" by Gordon and Mildred Gordon and was directed by Robert Stevenson. The title song was written by the Sherman Brothers and sung by Bobby Darin. The 1997 remake includes a cameo appearance by Dean Jones.", "score": 24.875}, {"long_text": "That Darn Cat (1997 film) | That Darn Cat is a 1997 American mystery comedy film starring Christina Ricci and Doug E. Doug. It is a remake of the 1965 film \"That Darn Cat! \", which in turn was based on the book \"Undercover Cat\" by Gordon and Mildred Gordon. It is directed by British TV veteran Bob Spiers (most famous for \"Fawlty Towers\", as well as \"Spice World\") and written by Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski, best known for \"Ed Wood\" and the first two \"Problem Child\" films.", "score": 21.9375}, {"long_text": "Eek! The Cat | Eek! The Cat (retitled Eek! Stravaganza in 1994) is an American-Canadian animated series, created by Savage Steve Holland and Bill Kopp and produced by Fox Kids and Savage Studios with animation by Nelvana, that ran from 1992 to 1997. It aired on YTV from 1992 to 1998 in Canada.", "score": 20.359375}]}

[[ ## thought_1 ## ]]
I have found the studios for both 'That Darn Cat!' and 'Never a Dull Moment'. Now I need to determine which studio produced both films.

[[ ## tool_name_1 ## ]]
AdvancedSearch

[[ ## tool_args_1 ## ]]
{"search_query": "Which studio produced both 'That Darn Cat!' and 'Never a Dull Moment'? ", "trajectory_id": "advance_search_result_2"}

[[ ## observation_1 ## ]]
{"search_query": "Which studio produced both 'That Darn Cat!' and 'Never a Dull Moment'? ", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "Felix the Cat Trifles with Time | Felix the Cat Trifles with Time also referred to as \"Felix Trifles with Time\" is a 1925 animated, black and white, silent short film by Pat Sullivan Studios, featuring Felix the Cat. Produced by E. W. Hammons, it featured the work of the animator Otto Messmer. It was the first cartoon of the series to be distributed by Educational Pictures.", "score": 16.4375}, {"long_text": "Fraidy Cat (film) | Fraidy Cat is a 1942 American one-reel animated cartoon and is the 4th \"Tom and Jerry\" cartoon produced by Fred Quimby for Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and directed by William Hanna and Joseph Barbera. It was released in theaters on January 17, 1942 and re-issued in 1952.", "score": 16.140625}, {"long_text": "Cats Don't Dance | Cats Don't Dance is a 1997 American animated musical comedy film distributed by Warner Bros. Family Entertainment and notable as the only fully animated feature produced by Turner Feature Animation. This studio was merged during the post-production of \"Cats Don't Dance\" into Warner Bros. Animation after the merger of Time Warner with Turner Broadcasting System in 1996. Turner Feature Animation had also produced the animated portions of Turner's \"The Pagemaster\" (1994).", "score": 16.03125}]}

[[ ## thought_2 ## ]]
I now need to find out which studio produced both 'That Darn Cat!' and 'Never a Dull Moment' from the search results.

[[ ## tool_name_2 ## ]]
AdvancedSearch

[[ ## tool_args_2 ## ]]
{"search_query": "Which studio produced both 'That Darn Cat!' and 'Never a Dull Moment'? ", "trajectory_id": "advance_search_result_2"}

[[ ## observation_2 ## ]]
{"search_query": "Which studio produced both 'That Darn Cat!' and 'Never a Dull Moment'? ", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "When the Cat's Away (1929 film) | When the Cat's Away is a 1929 Mickey Mouse short film produced by Walt Disney and Ub Iwerks. In it, Mickey and Minnie are the size of regular mice, and Tom Kat is the size of a person.", "score": 15.9765625}, {"long_text": "Time Passages | Time Passages is the eighth studio album by Al Stewart, released in September 1978. It is the follow-up to his 1976 album \"Year of the Cat\". The album, like 1975's \"Modern Times\" and 1976's \"Year of the Cat\", was once again produced by Alan Parsons. The album's title track (which, when edited, reached #7 on the \"Billboard\" charts) and \"End of the Day\" were both co-written by Peter White. The title track also reached #1 on the Billboard Adult Contemporary charts for 10 weeks.", "score": 15.8828125}, {"long_text": "Never a Dull Moment (Tommy Lee album) | Never a Dull Moment is the first solo album by then former Mötley Crüe drummer Tommy Lee, released on May 21, 2002 by MCA. Tommy Lee began writing music in September 2000, following Methods of Mayhem's stint on Ozzfest. Lee described the process in a 2002 interview:", "score": 15.7734375}]}

[[ ## thought_3 ## ]]
The search results indicate that Walt Disney Productions produced both 'That Darn Cat!' and 'Never a Dull Moment'. Therefore, the studio that produced both films is Walt Disney Productions.

[[ ## tool_name_3 ## ]]
AdvancedSearch

[[ ## tool_args_3 ## ]]
{"search_query": "What is the studio that produced both 'That Darn Cat!' and 'Never a Dull Moment'? ", "trajectory_id": "find_walt_disney_studio"}

[[ ## observation_3 ## ]]
{"search_query": "What is the studio that produced both 'That Darn Cat!' and 'Never a Dull Moment'? ", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "Bad Day at Cat Rock | A Bad Day at Cat Rock is a 1965 Tom and Jerry cartoon produced and directed by Chuck Jones as essentially a remake of his 1963 Wile E. Coyote and Road Runner cartoon \"To Beep or Not to Beep\". Maurice Noble was the cartoon's co-director, the animation was credited to Ben Washam, Ken Harris, Don Towsley and Dick Thompson. The music was scored by Eugene Poddany and backgrounds by Phil DeGuard. Mel Blanc was on hand to supply the screams, yells, and other vocal effects. The cartoon's title is a pun on the MGM film \"Bad Day at Black Rock\", though the cartoon's plot bears with no resemblance.", "score": 16.015625}, {"long_text": "The Cat's Me-Ouch! | The Cat's Me-Ouch is a 1965 cartoon produced and directed by Chuck Jones. The title is a parody of \"The cat's meow\", a phrase coined by Thomas A. Dorgan. The short features a tiny bulldog who would go on to make another appearance in the final Tom and Jerry cartoon produced by Chuck Jones, \"Purr-Chance to Dream\" in 1967.", "score": 15.84375}, {"long_text": "That's Cat | That's Cat was a children's television show that premiered on Saturday, September 18, 1976. It was both produced by and aired on KNBC, the NBC owned and operated (O&O) station in Los Angeles, California; it was also syndicated to selected NBC O&O stations.", "score": 15.734375}]}
demos.next_thought: The search results show that Walt Disney Productions produced both 'That Darn Cat!' and 'Never a Dull Moment'. However, the previous searches did not directly confirm this. Let's look for a more direct confirmation.

next_tool_args.search_query: Walt Disney Productions produced both 'That Darn Cat!' and 'Never a Dull Moment'?

demos.question: Ellis, Idaho is located on what major north-south highway?
demos.trajectory:
[[ ## tool_name_init ## ]]
AdvancedSearch

[[ ## tool_args_init ## ]]
{"search_query": "Ellis, Idaho is located on what major north-south highway?"}

[[ ## thought_init ## ]]
I will start by searching for relevant documents with the original question as the search query.

[[ ## observation_init ## ]]
{"search_query": "Ellis, Idaho is located on what major north-south highway?", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "Ellis, Idaho | Ellis is an unincorporated community in Custer County, Idaho, United States. Ellis is located on U.S. Route 93 15.5 mi northeast of Challis. Ellis has a post office with ZIP code 83235.", "score": 23.203125}, {"long_text": "Idaho State Highway 51 | State Highway 51 (SH-51) is a state highway in southwestern Idaho from Mountain Home south to the Nevada border, where it continues as State Route 225 to Elko. It is the major north–south road in Owyhee County.", "score": 21.046875}, {"long_text": "Idaho State Highway 11 | State Highway 11 (SH-11) is a state highway in northern Idaho. It runs 42.481 mi from U.S. Route 12 (US 12) near Greer, north to Headquarters.", "score": 20.84375}]}

[[ ## thought_0 ## ]]
After analyzing the initial search results, I find that U.S. Route 93 and State Highway 51 are mentioned. However, only U.S. Route 93 is explicitly stated as a north-south highway in the text. I should verify if there's more information about State Highway 51.

[[ ## tool_name_0 ## ]]
AdvancedSearch

[[ ## tool_args_0 ## ]]
{"search_query": "State Highway 51 location in Ellis, Idaho"}

[[ ## observation_0 ## ]]
{"search_query": "State Highway 51 location in Ellis, Idaho", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "Idaho State Highway 67 | State Highway 67 (SH-67) is a state highway in Idaho from SH-51 in Mountain Home to the Main Gate of Mountain Home AFB.", "score": 20.609375}, {"long_text": "Wyoming Highway 51 | Wyoming Highway 51 is a 24.79 mi long east-west Wyoming state highway located in Campbell and Crook Counties, between Gillette and Moorcroft.", "score": 20.59375}, {"long_text": "Idaho State Highway 53 | State Highway 53 (SH-53) is a 14.240 mi state highway serving Kootenai County in the U.S. state of Idaho. SH-53 travels northeast from Washington State Route 290 at the Washington state border near Hauser to a short concurrency with SH-41 in Rathdrum. From Rathdrum, the highway continues east to end at U.S. Route 95 (US-95) north of Hayden. The Hauser to Rathdrum segment first appeared on a map in 1926, while the continuation of the route to the Hayden area appeared in 1937, completing an unnumbered state highway. SH-53 was designated in 1953 after all unnumbered state highways were assigned numbers.", "score": 20.53125}]}

[[ ## thought_1 ## ]]
The search for State Highway 51 in Ellis, Idaho did not provide additional information beyond the mention of its existence. I now need to confirm if U.S. Route 93 is indeed the major north-south highway in Ellis, Idaho.

[[ ## tool_name_1 ## ]]
AdvancedSearch

[[ ## tool_args_1 ## ]]
{"search_query": "U.S. Route 93 location in Ellis, Idaho"}

[[ ## observation_1 ## ]]
{"search_query": "U.S. Route 93 location in Ellis, Idaho", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "U.S. Route 93 in Idaho | U.S. Route 93 (US 93) is a north–south U.S. Highway in the U.S. state of Idaho.", "score": 23.796875}, {"long_text": "U.S. Route 93 | U.S. Route 93 (US 93) is a major north–south United States highway in the western United States. The southern terminus is at US 60 in Wickenburg, Arizona. The northern terminus is at the Canada–US border north of Eureka in Lincoln County, Montana, where the roadway continues into Roosville, British Columbia, as Highway 93. Major cities that US 93 travels through include: Las Vegas, Nevada; Twin Falls, Idaho; Missoula, Montana; and Kalispell, Montana.", "score": 22.75}, {"long_text": "U.S. Route 93 Alternate (Nevada) | In the U.S. state of Nevada, U.S. Route 93 Alternate (US 93 Alt. or Alt 93) is an alternate route of U.S. Route 93 located in the northeast part of the state. It connects Lages Station to Wells via the town of West Wendover.", "score": 21.015625}]}

[[ ## thought_2 ## ]]
Based on the previous searches, U.S. Route 93 is mentioned in relation to Ellis, Idaho and is described as a major north-south highway in Idaho. No other significant north-south highway was found in Ellis, Idaho.

[[ ## tool_name_2 ## ]]
AdvancedSearch

[[ ## tool_args_2 ## ]]
{"search_query": "major north-south highway in Ellis, Idaho"}

[[ ## observation_2 ## ]]
{"search_query": "major north-south highway in Ellis, Idaho", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "Oklahoma State Highway 46 | State Highway 46 (abbreviated SH-46) is a state highway in northwest Oklahoma. It runs 49.3 mi south-to-north in Ellis and Harper Counties.", "score": 21.125}, {"long_text": "U.S. Route 95 in Idaho | In the U.S. state of Idaho, U.S. Route 95 is a north–south highway near the western border of the state, stretching from Oregon to British Columbia for over 538 mi ; it was earlier known in the state as the North and South Highway.", "score": 20.5625}, {"long_text": "Idaho State Highway 31 | Idaho State Highway 31 is a 21.025 mi north-south state highway in the eastern part of the U.S. state of Idaho. SH-31 runs from U.S. Route 26 in Swan Valley north to Idaho State Highway 33 in Victor. The highway is maintained by the Idaho Transportation Department. It is known as PIne Creek Road within Bonneville County. It is also known West Center Street in \"downtown\" Victor.", "score": 20.484375}]}
demos.next_thought: Next, I need to verify if U.S. Route 93 is indeed the major north-south highway in Ellis, Idaho by checking the context around it.

next_tool_args.search_query: major north-south highway in Ellis, Idaho U.S. Route 93

demos.question: What was the name of the man who Carol Kane played the wife of who was a lovable-but-goofy mechanic in a television series?
demos.trajectory:
[[ ## tool_name_init ## ]]
AdvancedSearch

[[ ## tool_args_init ## ]]
{"search_query": "What was the name of the man who Carol Kane played the wife of who was a lovable-but-goofy mechanic in a television series?"}

[[ ## thought_init ## ]]
I will start by searching for relevant documents with the original question as the search query.

[[ ## observation_init ## ]]
{"search_query": "What was the name of the man who Carol Kane played the wife of who was a lovable-but-goofy mechanic in a television series?", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "Carol Kane | Carolyn Laurie Kane (born June 18, 1952) is an American stage, screen and television actress and comedian. She became known in the 1970s in films such as \"Hester Street\" (for which she received an Academy Award nomination) and \"Annie Hall\". She appeared on the television series \"Taxi\" in the early 1980s, as the wife of Latka, the character played by Andy Kaufman, winning two Emmy Awards for her work. She has played the character of Madame Morrible in the musical \"Wicked\", both in regional productions and on Broadway from 2005 to 2014. Since 2015, she has been a main cast member on the Netflix original series \"Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt\", in which she plays Lillian Kaushtupper.", "score": 18.5625}, {"long_text": "Latka Gravas | Latka Gravas is a fictional character on the television sitcom \"Taxi\" portrayed by Andy Kaufman. A sweet-natured and lovable-but-goofy mechanic, Latka was based on a character Kaufman created known as Foreign Man.", "score": 16.53125}, {"long_text": "Leslie Herbert Kane | Leslie Herbert Kane (1 January 1945 – 19 October 1978) was an Australian gangster who lived in Melbourne, Australia. He was portrayed by Australian actor Martin Dingle Wall in the television series \"\" in 2009.", "score": 16.015625}]}

[[ ## thought_0 ## ]]
Based on the search results, it seems the question pertains to the character Latka Gravas from the show Taxi. I will now formulate a new search query to find out who Carol Kane's character married in the show.

[[ ## tool_name_0 ## ]]
AdvancedSearch

[[ ## tool_args_0 ## ]]
{"search_query": "Who was the character that Carol Kane married in the show Taxi?", "trajectory_id": "taxi_character_search"}

[[ ## observation_0 ## ]]
{"search_query": "Who was the character that Carol Kane married in the show Taxi?", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "Christian Kane | Christian Kane (born June 27, 1972) is an American actor and singer-songwriter. He is known for his roles in the television shows \"Angel\", \"Leverage\", \"The Librarians\" and \"Into the West\", and the movies \"Just Married\", \"Taxi\", and \"Secondhand Lions\".", "score": 19.28125}, {"long_text": "Born Romantic | Born Romantic is a 2000 British film directed by David Kane. The film is centered on a salsa club and depicts four love stories. Fergus is trying to find the one he left behind on the eve of their wedding, charmer and Rat Pack fanatic Frankie woos the beautiful Eleanor and the robber Eddie falls hopelessly in love with dowdy cemetery worker Jocelyn. Meanwhile, taxi driver Jimmy is transporting all of them and dealing with a love story of his own.", "score": 17.78125}, {"long_text": "Carol Roux | Carol Roux is an American actress who was an original cast member of \"Another World\" (1964) and was involved in one of the show's first major storylines. Melissa \"Missy\" Palmer (Roux) and Bill Matthews (Joseph Gallison) were a young couple in love, but in true soap opera fashion, their road to happiness had numerous hurdles, many the result of the interference of Bill's conniving mother Liz Matthews (Audra Lindley). The two were finally married and the characters left town. But their happiness was short-lived, as Bill was later drowned in a boating accident off screen.", "score": 17.296875}]}

[[ ## thought_1 ## ]]
From the search results, it seems Carol Kane married Latka Gravas in the show Taxi.

[[ ## tool_name_1 ## ]]
AdvancedSearch

[[ ## tool_args_1 ## ]]
{"search_query": "Who was the character that Carol Kane married in the show Taxi?", "trajectory_id": "taxi_character_search"}

[[ ## observation_1 ## ]]
{"search_query": "Who was the character that Carol Kane married in the show Taxi?", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "Dancers in the Dark | Dancers in the Dark is a 1932 American Pre-Code film about a taxi dancer (Miriam Hopkins), a big band leader (Jack Oakie), and a gangster (George Raft). The screenplay was written by Herman J. Mankiewicz (\"Citizen Kane\"), Brian Marlow and Howard Emmett Rogers from \"Jazz King\", a stage drama by James Ashmore Creelman, and directed by David Burton.", "score": 17.078125}, {"long_text": "Carol Kane (businesswoman) | Carol Kane (born October 1966) is a British businesswoman, the co-founder of and joint CEO of Boohoo.com.", "score": 16.828125}, {"long_text": "The Girl in the Taxi | The Girl in the Taxi is the English-language adaptation by Frederick Fenn and Arthur Wimperis of the operetta \"Die keusche Susanne\" (1910 in Magdeburg), with music by Jean Gilbert. The German original had a libretto by Georg Okonkowski. The story begins with a man and a woman, both married, who flag the same taxi and then decide to share it, as they have the same restaurant destination. Various naughty supper rendezvous, and much hiding under tables or behind screens, ensue.", "score": 16.375}]}

[[ ## observation_2 ## ]]
{"search_query": "Who was the character that Carol Kane married in the show Taxi, where she played the wife of a lovable-but-goofy mechanic?", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "Connie Hines | Connie Hines (March 24, 1931 – December 18, 2009) was an American actress, best known for playing Alan Young's wife, Carol Post, on the 1960s sitcom \"Mister Ed\".", "score": 17.4375}, {"long_text": "Carol Stone (actress) | Carol Montgomery Stone (February 1, 1915 – June 10, 2011) was an actress who played \"Big Nose Kate\", or Kate Holliday, the common law wife of Doc Holliday, in ten episodes in the 1957-1958 season of the ABC/Desilu western television series, \"The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp\".", "score": 17.25}, {"long_text": "The Doctor Takes a Wife | The Doctor Takes a Wife is a 1940 screwball comedy film starring Loretta Young and Ray Milland as a best-selling author and medical school instructor, respectively, who find it convenient to pretend to be married, even though they initially loathe each other.", "score": 17.109375}]}

She is a past winner of the coveted India's L'Oréal/Elite \"Look of the Year\" title. She was a contestant in Indian reality show Bigg Boss 1.", "score": 14.15625}, {"long_text": "Carol Lee Scott | Carol Lee Scott (20 December 1942 – 4 July 2017) was an English entertainer, best known for her role on British television in the 1980s and 1990s as \"Grotbags\". Throughout her career, Scott regularly performed on the international cabaret circuit, and prior to her TV work, she was a singer and released two albums.", "score": 14.09375}, {"long_text": "Carol Jackson | Carol Ann Jackson is a fictional character from the BBC soap opera \"EastEnders\", played by Lindsey Coulson. The character was introduced in 1993 as the mother of the Jackson family. Coulson decided to quit the role in 1997, but she returned temporarily in 1999 within a storyline that marked Carol's daughter Bianca's (Patsy Palmer) exit. On 25 October 2009 it was confirmed that she would return along with other members of the Jackson family, Sonia (Natalie Cassidy), Robbie (Dean Gaffney) and Billie (Devon Anderson), on 15 February 2010, although her first appearance in 2010 is in \"EastEnders: Last Tango in Walford\", an episode released exclusively to DVD on 8 February 2010. Coulson chose to leave the show for a third time in June 2015, with her exit aired on 2 October 2015.", "score": 14.0625}]}

demos.question: Which major river is Buford, North Dakota nearest to?
What U.S. court presided over both the Slaughter-House Cases and Reed v. Reed?
What is the difference in genre between The Fighting Prince of Donegal and The Graveyard Book?
Who directed the 1987 romantic drama dance film that is directly parodied by the television film "Totally Awesome"?
Who did Holly Dunn record "Daddy's Hands" for?
what song is in the movie directed by Paul Hoen based on the novel "if I had one wish"?
Which genre of Italian film was the first to use CGI?
Is Liverpool found in northern or southern England?
Evolution: A Theory in Crisis is a 1985 book by a biochemist and Senior fellow at Discovery Institute's Center for what?
Jay Simon is best known for her role as a flight attendant in a movie directed by which director ?
Which city did the writer of Enion spend most of his life?
The 1925 Saint Mary's Gaels football team represented what private, coeducational college in Moraga, California?
Kyle Moran was born in the town on what river?

signature.instructions:
Given the fields `question`, produce the fields `answer`.

You will be given `question`.

You must decide what to do next by providing:

- Thought: reasoning about the current step

- Tool Name: one of the available tools

- Tool Args: A valid JSON with the necessary keys.

Repeat this for a few steps to gather information.

You do not need to produce a final answer — just use the tools iteratively.
Make sure to include all required Tool Args as a valid JSON object.

(1) AdvancedSearch, whose description is <desc>Searches documents using a search_query.  Arguments:  - "search_query": an optimized search query for dense passage retrieval.  IMPORTANT: YOU MUST always PROVIDE "search_query" in the arguments!</desc>. It takes arguments {'search_query': 'str', 'trajectory_id': 'Union[str, NoneType]'} in JSON format.

{"search_query": "What was the name of the man who Carol Kane played the wife of who was a lovable-but-goofy mechanic in a television series?", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "Carol Kane | Carolyn Laurie Kane (born June 18, 1952) is an American stage, screen and television actress and comedian. She became known in the 1970s in films such as \"Hester Street\" (for which she received an Academy Award nomination) and \"Annie Hall\". She appeared on the television series \"Taxi\" in the early 1980s, as the wife of Latka, the character played by Andy Kaufman, winning two Emmy Awards for her work. She has played the character of Madame Morrible in the musical \"Wicked\", both in regional productions and on Broadway from 2005 to 2014. Since 2015, she has been a main cast member on the Netflix original series \"Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt\", in which she plays Lillian Kaushtupper.", "score": 18.5625}, {"long_text": "Latka Gravas | Latka Gravas is a fictional character on the television sitcom \"Taxi\" portrayed by Andy Kaufman. A sweet-natured and lovable-but-goofy mechanic, Latka was based on a character Kaufman created known as Foreign Man.", "score": 16.53125}, {"long_text": "Leslie Herbert Kane | Leslie Herbert Kane (1 January 1945 – 19 October 1978) was an Australian gangster who lived in Melbourne, Australia. He was portrayed by Australian actor Martin Dingle Wall in the television series \"\" in 2009.", "score": 16.015625}]}

demos.question: What is the difference in genre between The Fighting Prince of Donegal and The Graveyard Book?
